data.title: Boris Kit
data.text:
Marvel’s universal approach makes it a world apart from DC

As marvel embarks on transferring its universe of comics characters to the big screen, it is determined to succeed where DC Comics and its corporate sibling Warner Bros. have stumbled. But then, Marvel always has been one step ahead of DC.

Business News

By

Faris, Fogler ‘Kids’ again

Anna Faris and Dan Fogler are starring alongside Topher Grace in Universal Pictures and Imagine Entertainment's "Kids in America," a comedy directed by Michael Dowse being produced by Brian Grazer, Gordon Kaywin and Grace.

Business News

By

Romanek stalks Del Toro ‘Wolfman’

Director Mark Romanek has been hired to bring "The Wolfman" to the big screen. Scott Stuber and Mary Parent are producing the remake of the classic Universal Studios monster, which has Benicio Del Toro attached to star.

Business News

By

Beckinsale inks for ‘Whiteout’ adventure

Kate Beckinsale has signed to star in the action thriller "Whiteout," which Dominic Sena will direct for Joel Silver's Dark Castle. It's based on based on a comic book series set in Antarctica.

Business News

By

An afterlife for Scorsese’s ‘Departed’

Talks are under way to put together a sequel to crime thriller "The Departed," which has garnered five Oscar nominations and is the biggest boxoffice hit of Martin Scorsese's long career.

By

An afterlife for Scorsese’s ‘Departed’

Talks are under way for a sequel to "The Departed," which has five Oscar nominations and is the biggest boxoffice hit of Martin Scorsese's career.

Business News

By

Mendes joins Campbell on ‘Cleaner’ job

Eva Mendes is getting dirty for "Cleaner," a thriller from Millennium Films and Anonymous Content being directed by Renny Harlin.
